page.title: 04Woodditton
page.content: Woodditton is a small country village.Most of the houses are quite old but some modern ones are being built.The village pub is called the Three Blackbirds.It was built in 1642 and renovated in 1980.Woodditton also has a post office which is more of a village shop as it sells things such as cereals and washing powder.The village has a small church called St.Mary's whose church bells have just been restored and now the villagers ring them at 8 p.m. There is a transport business which is run by Mr Wiseman He is related to the man who runs the post office.Mr wiseman's minibuses take local children to school.The vlillage school closed two years ago and the building is now used to train broadcasting technicians for a Christian organisation.The population is about 190.
